2. Introduction

Goal: Build a modular banking system using microservices for accounts, customers, credits, payments, notifications, and admin approvals. Objectives include secure JWT-based authentication, clear service boundaries, service discovery, and admin-driven approvals with user notifications.
3. Solution Approach

Architecture: Microservices with Spring Boot and Spring Cloud. Each bounded context is a separate service (auth, customer, account, credit, payment, notification, admin), registered with Eureka and called via OpenFeign.
Security: OAuth2 Resource Server with JWT validation in downstream services. The API Gateway mediates traffic. Admin approvals trigger notifications to users.
Resilience: Resilience4j circuit breaker on admin fan-out reads (fallback to empty lists).
4. Implementation Details
Languages/Frameworks: Java 21, Spring Boot 3.2.x, Spring Web, Spring Data JPA, Spring Security (JWT), Spring Cloud (Eureka, OpenFeign, Resilience4j), Lombok, springdoc-openapi.
Databases: MySQL (e.g., notification-service uses MySQL with JPA).
Frontend: React (not covered in this backend case study, but present in the repository).
Deployment: Local dev via Spring Boot apps; no Kubernetes/CI configuration present in the repository.

7. Challenges & Mitigation

Transaction listing: Frontend queries /payments/user/{customerId}. Fixed backend to resolve the user's account IDs via account-service and fetch payments for those accounts; forwarded Authorization header in payment-service Feign to avoid 401s.
Eureka instance naming: Standardized eureka.instance fields so instances appear as service-name:port.
Notifications: Added endpoints for listing and seen/unseen; integrated admin approvals to push user notifications (KYC, accounts, credits, payments).
8. Conclusion

Benefits: Clear service boundaries, JWT-secured endpoints, admin approval workflows with user notifications, resilient Feign calls. Future enhancements: real-time notification streaming (SSE/WebSocket), richer audit logs, role-based reporting, and additional validations.
